topic.title: NameCoin news
topic.body:
News from namecoin.org

2017-03-03 ICANN has invited a Namecoin developer to speak at the ICANN58 meeting on March 11-16 2017 in Copenhagen, and Iâ€™m happy to say that Iâ€™ve accepted their invitation. Since Iâ€™m well aware that this may be surprising to some readers, I think itâ€™s beneficial to everyone to announce it here, and give some details about why Iâ€™ll be attending.

[Read moreâ€¦](https://www.namecoin.org/2017/03/03/icann-58.html)

2017-03-03 As a result of an invitation from Riccardo Spagni (AKA fluffypony of Monero), I will be speaking at the â€œPractical Cryptography & Blockchains: Beyond the Hypeâ€ track at QCon London 2017 (March 6-8 2017). My talk is entitled â€œCase Study: Alternate Blockchainsâ€. I will also be on a panel discussion alongside Paul Sztorc, David Vorick, Elaine Ou, Peter Todd, and Riccardo Spagni.

1_1MwJSNBC1savftEvXQyoHcVLDgThtAPr6T.body: I think you will be back ZeroNet in some days.

> [twiggydew](#comment_4_1MwJSNBC1savftEvXQyoHcVLDgThtAPr6T): ZeroBlog needs some form of a dashboard to easily change the background and add a header and maybe some themes like this example picture. http://imgur.com/a/ucYqx Things like this will attract more people (non-coders) to ZeroNet but will it ever get one? I doubt it.

You can do it, just clone the DEV's blog then add any thing you like.

1_17LQPJZz9sBC1besM5ZwKFKt9CmndJTjcA.body:
> [00d4n1](#comment_13_1Mr36Z4TSbWQ236NfvRPeLn3qsAwngBzMd): ZeroNet needs a blacklist option so that I don't have to seed anti-Semitic garbage like this.

You can do it by click [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1ABFCaadiEa3bFNzN3RcCZSsviqMNTbz3m/1GNgaj5EqkzqYECYbXa889fGLyuseHRi3t/1489552824) :)

> [00d4n1] does that actually stop me from seeding content published by that user, or just hide it?

Just hide it,hide his/her messages in the whole ZeroNet,so if you block he/she,you can NOT see he/her anymore.Because of you have NOT his/her private key ,so you can NOT delete it . Say something is his/her freedom.

> [00d4n1]Freedom of speech doesn't imply freedom to make innocent non-Nazis' computers spread your speech, y'know?

Maybe the only way you can do to NOT seeding the contents you don't like is to delete the whole site :)
